content.description: Steep climbing for three bolts, then lower angle easier climbing to the chains. The crux is finding the hidden holds to pull the roof.
content.location: Third-from-right bolt line on the wall.

content.description: Great beginning line for the canyon. And you can easily top rope it if you want. Hardest part of the climb is a little bulge between bolts 2, and 3.
content.protection: 6 bolts that take you to the chains.
content.location: There is a large flat belay station on the far right side of the wall. The first bolt is 12 feet off ground. There is also a loose tooth that may eventually come off.

content.description: Start up the near-vertical slab with smallish holds. Avoid the blocks to the right for the full affect. Getting above a shallow seam is a challenge, followed by one more thin vertical section to finish on at big top-out holds.
content.location: Lone route at the left side of the wall

content.description: The hard part is the slight overhang at the beginning, and then the mentally tough 2nd clip. From there its slab climbing with all around nice holds
content.location: The second-from-right on the wall, marked #2 on the topo

content.description:
Stick clip the first bolt and make a committing leap to the jug rail from the protruding rock or maybe the base of the wave feature. Get flexy and pull a few hard moves to get established on the flakes above (crux). Follow the left-trending bolt line through fun flakes and hidden holds up to a small ledge (5.10). Finish up on easy but dirty terrain.

The first move might be a heartbreaker if you're shorter or can't jump. It's worth pulling up to the rail to try what's above. By pulling on the first draw this can also be climbed at 5.10 A0.

Note: Since the FA I went back and built a launch platform to start the route. It's still a large leap but much easier now. If people don't like it, feel free to knock it over.
content.protection:
6 bolts + anchors with rings on top.

- Stick clip the first bolt

- Anchors are set up high on the ledge to avoid running over a sharp edge. TR accessible.
content.location: Currently the 2nd route from the left. Look for the obvious jug rail way up high.
